programmes.show_name: The Pembrokeshire Coast: A Wild Year
programmes.show_description: 1/3. A look at Pembrokeshire's wild and rugged coast, where life is defined by the rhythm of the seasons and the power of the sea.
3/20. Ainsley Harriott introduces classic recipes from some of the BBC's best-loved television chefs. The menu includes James Martin's delicious chicken stew.
4/8. Mervin and the team are called to a local church to investigate the death of an elderly parishioner in a case that hits close to home for Officer Rose.
1/6. Anna and Rachel share a flat in Dublin, where late nights and messy mornings are the norm. Contains strong language and scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.
30/50. In rural Shropshire, Alistair Appleton helps newlyweds from an Essex town find a traditional home and meets a local artist for some feather-filled poultry painting en plein air.
It's double Dion in Nottinghamshire as he magically recreates himself, but can he find the key to get outside?
9/15. There is one delicious food that is adored the world over: chocolate. But Marcus loves a good old-fashioned British bar, so can the French convince him that they do it better?
10/15. The Brits and French share a passion for poisson. Marcus wants to discover which fish they celebrate in Provence, and if they have a dish to rival the great British fish and chips.
Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.
Catrin Heledd introduces live coverage from Venue Cymru as the second round of the Welsh Open gets under way.
13/25. Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being number one is everything as five contestants compete to take control and knock the Boss out of the game.
3/60. Paul Martin presents from Watts Gallery in Surrey, the arts-and-crafts home of artists Mary and George Frederic Watts, with experts David Harper and Natasha Raskin.

programmes.show_name: New: Richard Osman's House of Games
programmes.show_description: 78/100. Michelle Ackerley, Katie Derham, Karen Hauer and Geoff Norcott face more trivia questions.
3/20. It's personal for Vernon Kay as he tests TV icon Anneka Rice, comedian Shane Todd and Radio 1Xtra DJ Remi Burgz on his home town of Bolton, aided by eager tour guide Paul Gorton.
Abigail Davies introduces live coverage as the second round of the Welsh Open continues at Venue Cymru.
2/29. The remaining three chefs from north west England compete over mains and desserts inspired by the British film industry. Who will win, and who must go home?
An insight into the secretive 'matchstick men' painter as he guides us through his revealing life story in unheard interviews from the end of his life, lip-synced by Ian McKellen.
1/6. Freya struggles with her career and misses Jo, leading her to make an impulsive decision. Contains very strong language and adult humour
Insights and global interviews on the news stories of the day. With Victoria Derbyshire.   Followed by Weather.
Abigail Davies introduces highlights from the second round of the Welsh Open in Llandudno.
John Simpson explores the mood in Ukraine after four years of war, examines how the war has changed Russia, and looks at whether Russia's long sporting isolation is coming to an end.
2/5. Wildlife documentary telling the story of Moja, a five-month-old lion cub living with his single lioness mum, Nyota, in Kenya's Masai Mara. Together, they face a fight for life.
4/12. The candidates must create a TV ad and a social media campaign for bottled water.
4/11. Angela Scanlon and guests take a deep dive into the candidates' performances.
3/4. Simon tries to warn his friends as the latest beast sighting spreads terror across the camps. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
1/29. Four chefs compete for north west England with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by the British film industry. Who will be eliminated?
Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.
An estranged brother and sister come face to face for the first time in nearly five years. Will two days in the wild be enough to heal the rift between them?
It's an emotional reunion for the new owner of a Staffordshire house.
11/15. The British people are proud of their beef dishes, and the French are too. Steak frites is a national institution, but in Provence, Marcus is expecting something a little different.
12/15. Herbes de Provence is famous. But with no UK equivalent, Marcus wants to create his own simple dried herb mix to rival this French classic and turn any dull dish into a tasty meal.
Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.
The big political issues of the day.
Catrin Heledd introduces live coverage of the last-16 matches at Venue Cymru, where quarter-final places are up for grabs.
14/25. Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where contestants compete for the cash prize. Who will rise to the top and see off their challengers?
25/60. A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series, with brand new valuations and unexpected auctions.

programmes.show_name: New: Richard Osman's House of Games
programmes.show_description: 79/100. Michelle Ackerley, Katie Derham, Karen Hauer and Geoff Norcott face more trivia questions.
4/20. Vernon Kay, with Paul Gorton in tow, challenges Anneka Rice, comedian Shane Todd and DJ Remi Burgz to separate the real from the ridiculous. This time, the destination is Jedburgh.
Abigail Davies introduces live coverage of the last-16 matches at the Welsh Open.
3/29. It's judging day, and only one chef can go through to represent north west England. Casting director Debbie McWilliams helps decide the winner from the two remaining chefs.
Lauren Salter and guests discuss the latest in Welsh rugby.
2/7. The brilliant Ed Gamble introduces comedians Tom Davis and Judi Love to the stage. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
5/11. Angela Scanlon and guests take a deep dive into the candidates' performances.
Insights and global interviews on the news stories of the day. With Paddy O'Connell.   Followed by Weather.
Abigail Davies introduces highlights from today's last-16 matches.

programmes.show_name: Planet Earth: A Tale of Three Bears
programmes.show_description: 1/5. Julia Bradbury presents the live wildlife programme following the progress of three black bear cubs as they follow their mother through the spectacular Northwoods of Minnesota.
